is a small town in Phongsali Province of
. Most people use it as a transit town (the halfway point between several other places), but it has its own charm.

value: A simple map of Muang Khua

Muang Khua can be reached from four directions: the Nam Ou river crosses through it from north to south, while the roads head east and west.
To the west, lies the transit hub of
. In the east, the road connects Muang Khua to the northernmost border crossing with

. Buses leave daily from Dien Bien Phu's bus station early in the morning. Travel time is around 5 hours, including customs.

Buses from
stop 2km away on the west side (35,000 kip for the bus and 5,000 kip for a collective tuk-tuk to the town centre).
Muang Khua is about halfway between
in the north and the backpacker-popular village of

.

Tickets can be bought from the boat dock, half an hour before the boat leaves. From the visitors centre, with the market in front of you, turn left and take the first street right. It is at the end of this road (you will have walked past three guesthouses and be on a downward slope). The boat to
(written Muang Ngoy on the boat dock sign) are 100,000 kip. Tickets to
(an hour south of Muang Ngoy) are 120,000 kip. Boats may not leave if there are not enough people (~12 people per boat) (Oct 2013).
Muang Khua can be covered by foot.

value: There are two ATMs in town. The tourist centre said this was new. (Nov 2013). It is possible to change dollars and baht. There are two places in town that change money at reasonable rates (Jun 2012). The banks may close at 15:30 and not be open on weekends.
The market is opposite tourist info in a curved roof shed. There are stalls with toiletries, clothes and food.

There are three restaurants on the road to the boat ramp. Drinks, 7-15,000 kip, Meals, 25-35,000 kip.

value: There are a few guesthouses on the road to the boat ramp. The tourist office also has a map of the area with others.
content=Large double room with fan, TV, private bathroom. No Wi-Fi, computers with Internet downstairs, 10,000 kip per hour.
Wi-Fi not available at most guesthouses, but computers are available.
